
# Variable selection

We are now only working with the transformed data from the transformation chapter.

```{r}
trainTransf <- trainBCAllIBM2
testTransf <- testBCAllIBM2
trainTransfNO <-trainBCNOIBM2
testTransfNO <- testBCNOIBM2
```

Lets try to use BIC and AIC criteria to select our variables.

```{r}
# BIC test
null <- lm(nuvirdi~1, data = trainTransf)
full <- lm(nuvirdi~ ., data = trainTransf)
lm.BIC <- step(null, scope = list(lower=null,upper=full),
     direction="both", k=log(dim(trainTransf)[1]))
Radj.BICStep <- CalculateRadjLambda(lm.BIC, testTransf, lambdaAll) # 0.8889675 rétt: 0.8352896

# AIC test
lm.AIC <- step(null, scope = list(lower=null,upper=full),
     direction="both", k=2)
Radj.AICStep <- CalculateRadjLambda(lm.AIC, testTransf, lambdaAll) # 0.889269 # rétt: 0.8360234
```

```{r}
RadjVector <- data.table()

RadjVector <- c(c("","","","","",""),c(Radj.allBc,Radj.allNOBc,Radj.allBcIBM2,Radj.allNOBcIBM2,Radj.BICStep, Radj.AICStep))
```
